info.headline: Wind Chill Watch issued January 14 at 2:49PM CST until January 17 at 10:00AM CST by NWS Corpus Christi
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 3 AM TO 3 PM CST MONDAY... ...WIND CHILL WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM LATE MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, light freezing rain is expected. For the Wind Chill Watch, dangerously cold wind chills possible. Wind chills as low as 10 above zero. * WHERE...Jim Wells, Inland Kleberg, Inland Nueces, Coastal Kleberg and Coastal Nueces. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 3 AM to 3 PM CST Monday. For the Wind Chill Watch, from late Monday night through Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. The dangerously cold wind chills could result in hypothermia or frostbite if precautions are not taken.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
